title: Rodolfo Tommasi
text:
Rodolfo Tommasi (24 November 1907 – 13 August 1993) was an Italian <a href="Association%20football">football</a>er.
Born in <a href="Opatija">Abbazia</a>, <a href="Kingdom%20of%20Italy%20%281861%E2%80%931946%29">Kingdom of Italy</a>, he played as forward for several Italian clubs. He started plying with local Olympia Abbazia, then he had a spell with <a href="ACF%20Fiorentina">ACF Fiorentina</a> in the <a href="1928%E2%80%9329%20Divisione%20Nazionale">1928–29 Divisione Nazionale</a>. Between 1929 and 1931 he played with <a href="U.S.%20Fiumana">Fiumana</a> in the <a href="Serie%20B">Serie B</a> and then with <a href="Unione%20Triestina%202012%20S.S.D.">Triestina</a> in the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Serie%20A">1931–32 Serie A</a>.
He also played abroad, with <a href="OFK%20Beograd">BSK Belgrade</a> in the <a href="1932%E2%80%9333%20Yugoslav%20Football%20Championship">1932–33 Yugoslav Football Championship</a>. While playing in Yugoslavia he played as Rudolf Tomašić.
He died in his birthplace, in 1993, by then known as Opatija and part of Croatia.
